meanings.sent1: She skiddoos out of the room when she heard the loud noise.
meanings.sent2: He always skiddoos away when it's time to do chores.
meanings.sent3: The cat skiddoos out of the house as soon as the vacuum cleaner starts.
meanings.sent4: The students skiddoos from the classroom as soon as the bell rings.
meanings.sent5: The thief skiddoos down the alley to escape the police.

meanings.definition: Used to express dismissal or rejection.
meanings.sent1: Skiddoos! I don't want to hear any more excuses.
meanings.sent2: Skiddoos! I'm not interested in your offer.
meanings.sent3: Skiddoos! That idea is just not going to work.
meanings.sent4: Skiddoos! Get out of here with that nonsense.
meanings.sent5: Skiddoos! I'm done with this conversation.
